marketNews.title: US President Trump Extends Tariff Pause for 90 Days on Chinese Goods
marketNews.content: US President, Donald Trump, on Monday (11/8) extended the pause on the implementation of tariffs on goods originating from China for 90 days until November 10, 2025, a move that could ease concerns over a tariff war and provide time for the two countries to negotiate further. Previously, in June 2025, China and the US had reached a trade framework agreement. Bloomberg reported that if Trump had not extended the pause, tariffs on goods originating from China to the US would have jumped to at least 54% by early Tuesday (12/8) local time.

marketNews.title: Indonesia Stock Exchange Announces PT Phintraco Sekuritas as First Liquidity Provider License Holder
marketNews.content: The Indonesia Stock Exchange (BEI) on Monday (11/8) announced that PT Phintraco Sekuritas has become the first exchange member to officially obtain a license to act as a stock liquidity provider. Previously, the BEI in May 2025 had released 2 new regulations that served as a legal basis for implementing liquidity provider activities to enhance the depth and quality of the stock market.

marketNews.title: Director of PT Agrinas Pangan Nusantara Resigns Citing Zero Budget and Bureaucracy Issues
marketNews.content: The President Director of PT Agrinas Pangan Nusantara, Joao Angelo de Sousa Mota, on Monday (11/8) resigned from his position despite only serving for 6 months, citing the reason that his team had not yet received funding from the government. Mota also highlighted Danantara, which according to him, has complicated bureaucracy that hinders progress. Responding to this issue, Danantara CEO, Rosan Roeslani, told Antara on Monday (11/8) that the company strictly applies good corporate governance (GCG) principles. Rosan also mentioned that every corporate action is implemented after passing a comprehensive feasibility study, with every decision made based on prudence principles to support the company's performance sustainability and maintain stakeholder trust. PT Agrinas Pangan Nusantara itself was formed to oversee the large-scale food estate development plan and build an integrated supply chain, according to a Bloomberg report.

tickerNews.title: Bel S.A. Acquires 22.5% Stake in KEJU worth Rp709 Billion
tickerNews.content: French Mitra Garudafood Putra Putri Jaya ($GOOD) associate, Bel S.A., purchased approximately 1.3 billion shares of Mulia Boga Raya ($KEJU) at an average price of 560 rupiah per share on August 8, 2025, which is 12.5% lower than KEJU's closing share price of 640 rupiah per share on the same trading day. Following this transaction worth approximately 709 billion rupiah, Bel S.A.'s ownership in KEJU increased from none to 22.5%. This transaction follows GOOD's announcement last week of a framework agreement to collaborate with Bel S.A. to jointly become the controller in KEJU. GOOD also explained that Bel S.A. will gain management rights to determine KEJU's financial and operational policies. Before this cooperation, GOOD held a 66.07% ownership stake in KEJU as of the end of July 2025. This collaboration aims to develop KEJU's business by leveraging Bel S.A.'s expertise in the cheese and cheese-based snack categories. Bel S.A. itself is a renowned global cheese producer, having been established for over 150 years and currently owning global brands such as The Laughing Cow and Kiri. During 1H25, KEJU recorded net profit growth of +37% YoY (vs. 1H24: +85% YoY) and revenue growth of +12% YoY (vs. 1H24: +28% YoY). KEJU's share price strengthened again by +16% on Tuesday (12/8) following the announcement of the transaction value today, after having corrected on Friday (7/8) when the framework agreement between GOOD and Bel S.A. was announced. Key Takeaway: As seen in the table, Bel S.A.'s acquisition of KEJU was done at a valuation generally considered premium compared to peers, although at a discount to KEJU's current valuation. Higher profitability (ROE) and better performance growth potentially justify the premium valuation. Furthermore, the synergy that can be generated - considering Bel S.A.'s expertise in related businesses - is another potential upside seen by Bel S.A., hence the company views attractive value in this transaction.

tickerNews.title: ASII July 2025 Wholesales Down 15% YoY, Market Share Declines
tickerNews.content: 1. $ASII: Astra International recorded car wholesales of 31,772 units in July 2025 (-27% YoY, +8% MoM). This result brought ASII's wholesales for 7M25 to 233,405 units (-15% YoY), with market share dropping to 53.6% (vs. 7M24: 56.9%).

tickerNews.title: KRYA Plans Rights Issue to Fund ECGO Electric Motorcycle Expansion to 55,000 Units in 2026
tickerNews.content: 2. $KRYA: Bisnis reported that Bangun Karya Perkasa Jaya plans to conduct a rights issue targeting fund acquisition of around 200-300 billion rupiah. KRYA's President Director and ECGO CEO, William Teng, told Bisnis that this corporate action is intended to support ECGO's expansion in 2026, where the company targets combined sales of 55,000 electric motorcycles. KRYA itself announced early this week a plan to inject capital into EVGO producer, PT Green City Traffic, worth approximately 10.4 billion rupiah, which will increase KRYA's ownership in the company to 51%.

tickerNews.title: ADHI Receives Letter of Award for Inpex's Masela Block LNG Project FEED Contract
tickerNews.content: 3. $ADHI: Adhi Karya announced that it has received a letter of award for the front-end engineering design (FEED) work contract for Inpex's LNG project in the Masela Block, valued at US$20 billion. This project will be executed by ADHI through a joint operation with KBR and Samsung E&A. ADHI did not specify the contract value for this project.

tickerNews.title: PTPP Records New Contract Value of ~IDR 11.8 Trillion in 7M25, 41.4% of 2025 Target
tickerNews.content: 4. $PTPP: PT PP recorded a new contract value of approximately 11.8 trillion rupiah during 7M25 (-10% YoY), equivalent to 41.4% of the 2025 target set at 28.5 trillion rupiah. The new contract value was dominated by private sector projects at 42%, followed by State-Owned Enterprises (39%) and the government (19%).

tickerNews.title: GULA's Chief Commissioner Increases Stake in PPRI Following Recent Purchases
tickerNews.content: 5. $PPRI: The President Commissioner of Aman Agrindo ($GULA), Irsyad Hanif, purchased 50 million shares of Paperocks Indonesia at an average price of 211 rupiah per share on August 8, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 10.6 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, Irsyad Hanif's direct ownership portion in PPRI increased from 15.61% to 17.94%. Previously, Irsyad Hanif had purchased 140 million PPRI shares at an average price of 50 rupiah per share on August 7, 2025.

tickerNews.title: CBRE Signs Agreement to Purchase Pipe-laying and Lifting Vessel worth US$100 Million for Portfolio Diversification
tickerNews.content: Cakra Buana Resources Energi ($CBRE) signed an agreement to purchase a pipe-laying and lifting vessel worth US$100 million or approximately 1.6 trillion rupiah. Funding for this transaction will come from the company's cash reserves and financing facilities from third parties and/or banking institutions. This transaction is intended to diversify the company's business portfolio into the offshore support vessel (OSV) segment, moving away from its previous focus on dry bulk fleet types.
